responses.content:
```yaml
leads:
  - headline: Open Redirect in OIDC Authentication Flow
    analysis: |
      The `OIDCAuthServiceImpl` class uses the `HttpServletUtils.getSourceURL` method to determine the redirect URL after successful authentication. This method retrieves the URL from the `Referer` header, which is user-controllable.
      An attacker could manipulate the `Referer` header to redirect the user to an arbitrary website after successful authentication.
    cwe: CWE-601
    function_names:
      - createSuccessRedirectURI
    filenames:
      - oidc-authenticator/src/main/java/org/xwiki/contrib/oidc/auth/OIDCAuthServiceImpl.java
    classification: slightly promising
```

leads.headline: Open Redirect in OIDC Authentication Flow
leads.analysis:
The OIDCAuthServiceImpl class uses the HttpServletUtils.getSourceURL method to determine the redirect URL after successful authentication. This method retrieves the URL from the Referer header, which is user-controllable.
An attacker could manipulate the Referer header to redirect the user to an arbitrary website after successful authentication.
